generated_description: westerkirk parish library, legally known as westerkirk parish library trust, based in langholm, scotland, manages the westerkirk parish library. established in 1793, it is one of the oldest lending libraries in scotland still lending books. the library was initially started by the westerhall mining company, which presented miners with a set of 23 books. over the years, the library has grown significantly, with the current purpose-built building constructed in 1863. the library is managed by a group of trustees who maintain the investment and building, and employs staff to take care of the grounds. it is a significant resource for local history and genealogy, offering a vast collection of old books. the library is a registered charity and is currently involved in restoration efforts to preserve its historical significance.
